intro: Coprosma novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are glossy and oval-shaped, often with a reddish or purple tinge when young. The flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or pale pink, appearing in spring and summer.
